May 6-7, 2025

Station F, Paris

Register Now
View Agenda

The Open for SDG Conference brings together United Nations leaders, open-source communities and innovators from across the globe to explore how open technologies can advance the 2030 Agenda. Co-organized by the United Nations and GOSIM, this conference creates a unique platform for dialogue between policymakers, technologists, and civil society to accelerate progress toward the Sustainable Development Goals through open collaboration.

Conference Themes

Explore how open-source technologies can accelerate progress toward specific SDGs

Open Data for the UN SDGs

Sharing case studies on public healthcare data and brainstorming an open data initiative to support evidence-based policymaking.

Open Policy for the UN SDGs

Discussing governance models, contribution pathways and policy considerations for UN engagement with open-source projects.

Open Science for the UN SDGs

Highlighting open science principles, barriers, enablers and ethical considerations for collaborative research.

Future AI for the UN SDGs

Envisioning inclusive, responsible AI futures and exploring how advanced AI can serve sustainable development.

Show & Tell

Spotlighting practical use cases and open-source projects that are actively supporting the UN SDGs.

Open Source & the Sustainable Development Goals

Achieving the 17 Sustainable Development Goals requires scalable, affordable and inclusive digital solutions. Open-source projects – ranging from software and data sets to artificial intelligence models, standards and content – form the backbone of what the UN calls digital public goods. These shared resources unlock innovation and equity by allowing anyone to build upon and localize proven technologies. The Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies notes that investing in open-source software, open data, open AI models, open standards and open content is key to achieving the SDGs.

Learn More About SDGs

About the UN Office for Digital & Emerging Technologies (ODET)

As of 1 January 2025, the United Nations transitioned the Envoy on Technology into the Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies (ODET). The new office holds a strengthened mandate to help the UN address the rapidly evolving technological landscape and to support implementation of the Global Digital Compact. ODET champions an inclusive, multistakeholder approach to digital governance rooted in the UN Charter, human rights and the sustainable development agenda.

Partner Organizations

This conference is made possible through the collaboration of leading organizations committed to open-source innovation and sustainable development.

The Venue

Station F - The World's Largest Startup Campus

5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris, France

Join us at Station F, a vibrant innovation hub in the heart of Paris. This iconic venue brings together entrepreneurs, investors, and innovators from around the world, making it the perfect location for exploring how open-source technologies can drive sustainable development.

Expected Outcomes

Participants will contribute to developing tangible outcomes that advance the SDG agenda

Policy Framework

A comprehensive framework for UN engagement with open-source projects, including governance models and contribution guidelines.

Open Data Initiative

Launch of a collaborative open data initiative to support evidence-based policymaking for sustainable development.

Partnership Network

Establishment of a global network connecting UN agencies, open-source communities, and civil society organizations.
